poem:
Title: Upon Parchment of Blood-stained Sands

Layers of power tremble, yea,
As justice sifts the desert sand,
Scourging winds whip Gaza's strand.
Decree descends on Judgment's Day.
Silent, watch the stones from stand.
Will blind scales lead, or penance pay?
Preserve the tears in fists of dismay,
On this crucible of Earth, we stand:
God's verdict in a mortal hand.
